result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth J Chavez

records.addlTxt: SDCNI has been returned by USPS.  Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to Forward.
Spoke with Dave in GLSO Dispatch to cancel warrant. 44

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.

1:32 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, has received an offer and will accept.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to the charge, will recommend a fine and costs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  $100 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 1:36 p.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:50 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant requests a Speedy Trial.   Court will set for Status Hearing on June 22, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:52 p.m.
